info.title: MyTime Partners API
info.description:
As a MyTime Partner, you’ll be able to use restful endpoints to build an apps that helps you register customers, schedule and configure classes, appointments, and enroll customers in the events you’ve configured.

First Steps
---
Getting an X-Api-Key
--
The first thing you will need to make an API request is a partners API key. This is a manually generated that should be kept secure. It is used to identify each partner and validate each API request. If you don’t have a key yet, please reach out to our support team.


Setting Header Values for Each Request
---
Header: X-Api-Key

For each API request, pass your X-Api-Key in the as a header value. This should be sent by each consumer of the API. This is a 40~ characters string and is the same one you would use to login on the documentation. For using the Swagger Interactive Documentation we should use the green ‘Authorize’ button to set this header.
E.g. Company X has the API_KEY=abcd they would send the header “X-Api-Key: abcd”

Header: Accept-Encoding

If we want to use the Swagger Interactive Documentation we should include this header on each request. This can be easily done by using a Chrome extension called 'Modify Headers’. If we don’t send this the request will be finalized correctly but the results won’t be returned correctly to the Swagger interface.

Header: X-Subdomain

This will be sent by consumers which are on their own infrastructure and have a custom subdomain. E.g. Company ABC Grooming can use abc.mytime.com thus will be sending “X-Subdomain: Abc” with every request they do through Partner APIs.

Header: X-Partner

  Some of our partners require custom API responses for integration. For such partners API responses will be formatted to suit the needs of that particular integration.

  Appointments and Classes
  ----
  If you have a business that services for groups of people for each event (eg. Yoga classes), you will use Classes, Class Sessions, Class Categories, and Attendee Types to build out your app.

If your business services one person at a time (eg. Haircuts, pet care), you will use the Appointments, and Open Times endpoints to build out your app.

Formatting Dates and DateTimes
---
All of the Date and Dates are formatted using the iso8601 standard.

Mytime ID vs Partner ID/External ID
---
If you need to migrate data from your own system, it will be useful to refer to your own internal IDs when calling the Partner API instead of the ids generated in our database. If you aren’t migrating any data, there’s no need to worry about a partner_id, you can use mytime id when referencing objects.

A Mytime ID, (eg. location_mytime_id, client_mytime_id) is auto generated by our MySQL Database and is always an INT or BIGINT.

A Partner ID/External ID (eg. location_partner_id, client_partner_id)is an external id which can be set by an API Consumer. This can be useful in case you have your own database which you want to sync with Mytime’s database.

tags.name: Client
tags.description: A client is a customer or a patron. Use these restful endpoints to register, retrieve a list of customers, show, update, and delete. Clients can enroll in both classes and appointments.

tags.name: Children
tags.description: A child is a generic endpoint for and represents what a client brings to an appointment or class. Initially it was built for children but it can also represent a pet.

tags.name: Attendee Types
tags.description:
You can configure different Attendee Types for promotions or special attendees to a class.
            (Eg. Employee, Promotion XYZ, Promotion ABC).

tags.name: OpenTime
tags.description: Open times represent when your business has an availability for an Appointment.

tags.name: Appointment
tags.description: And appointment is a one on one service involving your business (eg. Haircut, Dog Wash)

tags.name: Location
tags.description: A location is a distinct storefront for your business.

tags.name: Class Sessions
tags.description: A Class Session is a specific instance of a class. (eg. “Hot Yoga on Thursday”)"

tags.name: Resources
tags.description: Resources belong to Locations and are used in Classes and Class Sessions. A Class Resource is something that a class will reserve for the duration of the class, eg. a room, sound system.

tags.name: Class Categories
tags.description: Class Categories are used to organize different types of classes. , eg. "Yoga"

tags.name: Session Enrollments
tags.description:
Session Enrollments represent the attendance of a client to a class session.
            You need at least a class session id, a client id, and an attendee type id to make this api call.

tags.name: External Locations
tags.description: Locations outside of store which can be used for scheduling classes.

tags.name: Labels
tags.description: Labels that can be attached to clients

tags.name: CustomField
tags.description: Custom fields defined on a company.

get.summary: Returns all clients from the system that the user has access to.
get.description:
For each user - identified by user and password - we should have only one client per company.
        Different MyTime Companies will have different client records for each user.
